intro: Rourea grosourdyana var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-leafed rourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
